title: For a survey of some of the issues involved, concentrating on the uses made of the Revolution “as a rhetorical strategy” in the ratifying debate, each side attempting thereby to influence public opinion in its favor
The American Revolution as ‘Yardstick’ in the Debates on the Constitution, 1787–1788

In this Postscript I do not consider the debate on the Constitution as rhetoric, but as reality; I concentrate on the conceptual problems that framed the Founders’ understanding; and I stress the continuities in the basic ideology of the Revolution. For an excellent presentation of a similar view carried into the decade after the Constitution, see Lance Banning, “Republican Ideology and the Triumph of the Constitution, 1789–1793
